intro: Peucedanum porandicum, commonly known as Persian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
